title: icopress
author: icopress
created_time: April 03, 2023, 05:03:55 PMLast edit: December 28, 2023, 06:18:52 PM by icopress
content: Quote from:   ➥ Your Crypto Anonymity [UniJoin Clearnet] & [Tor Mirror] & [UniJoin ANN]  ➥ Unijoin Campaign [Altcoinstalks]UniJoin is a crypto mixer that restores anonymity to your crypto funds. [banned mixer] uses CoinJoin technology that enables multiple Bitcoin transactions to be combined into one with multiple inputs and outputs. This provides a level of anonymity and security as it becomes hard to determine which input corresponds to which output. No Stored Logs / The fee per mixing operation ranges between 1% - 3% and is generated with a decimal number of 4 digits.Main Info:➥ No minimum quota/maximum 30 posts➥ Posts after 23:59 UTC Sunday will be counted towards the following week.Code:$3/post$4/post (if you have more than 1000 merit).Rules:➥ Posts in local sections will be taken into account.➥ Post bursting is not allowed, moreover it is easy to check with ninjastic.space.➥ Posts that do not carry a semantic load or posts whose content is less than 200 characters will not be paid.➥ I reserve the right to change the rules and disqualify any post and any participant for any reason.➥ There are a few more obvious things that I haven't mentioned, but which I'll keep a close eye on.➥ Posts published after page 15 will not be counted.➥ Excluded boards, (Altcoins, WO & Serious, Sig Threads, Press, Politics, Games, Micro, Off-topic, Mega Threads.).Application:➥ Do not send me your application by PM and do not ask why you were not accepted [1], [2].Code:Username:BTC SegWit Address:Quote                                              /en/download-public-key][1]: When reviewing applications, the campaign manager pays attention to many details, including; how informative and organic your posts are, for what and how often you get merit, do you have a customized trust list and do you use a feedback system. A sig campaign is an “ad” for the customer and a “hobby” for the participants, so the manager will definitely pay attention to whether you have shown interest in previously promoted projects. The above points are a sure way to understand whether you will be useful for promoting a particular project or service.[2]: Your application was rejected for one of the possible reasons: if you have more negative feedback than positive, if there is an active flag, if you have a neutral feedback left by actmyname, or if you have neutral feedback from another DT member who flagged you as a sig spammer, if you are abusing posting in mega threads. Also, how evenly distributed your posts are in relation to the number of threads in which these posts were written. Depending on how many users from your local section have applied and how often you move from one campaign to another, etc.
